meanings.definition: To carve or engrave on wood.
meanings.sent1: She xylographed a beautiful design onto the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: The artist xylographed a detailed pattern onto the block of wood.
meanings.sent3: He xylographed his initials on the tree trunk, thinking he was a wood artist.
meanings.sent4: The memories were xylographed into the old wooden door, telling stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the xylographed chisel echoed through the quiet forest.

meanings.definition: A print made from a woodcut.
meanings.sent1: The xylographed image on the paper was a masterpiece of precision.
meanings.sent2: She admired the xylographed print hanging on the gallery wall.
meanings.sent3: The xylographed picture of the forest looked so real, she tried to touch the trees.
meanings.sent4: The xylographed artwork seemed to capture the essence of nature in a single frame.
meanings.sent5: The xylographed illustration brought the beauty of the woodcut to life.
